title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Logistics Company

description.narrative: The objective of this program is to provide training and equipment for a company-sized force to enable it to support CT units logistically. Equipment provided includes vehicles, radios, organizational clothing and personal equipment, weapons and ammunition, and medical equipment. Minor military construction will be provided to refurbish a maintenance facility.

title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Logistic Infrastructure Support

description.narrative: To conduct or support programs providing training and equipment to national security forces of foreign countries for the purpose of building capacity of partner nations. The Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) provides program management. Country teams work through DoD geographic Combatant Commands (COCOMs).

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Niger - Defense Institution Building Security Governance Initiative #5. Design of a pilot project to test the healthy water for healthy soldiers concept. Support the development of a draft plan for achieving and tracking key tasks with regard to achieving C-130 initial/full operating capability (IOC/FOC); and support the the Niger Air Force (NiAF) staff with capabilities-based planning (CBP). Publish copies of the approved vehicle standards manual and plan for distribution.

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Niger - Lake Chad Region Directors of Military Intelligence Workshop. Attend the Lake Chad Region (LCR) Directors of Military Intelligence Workshop; Support the development of Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) capabilities of ISG programs in Niger, Chad, and Cameroon; Represent ISG interests and concepts; Provide expert insights on ISR-related issues...

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Niger - Security Governance Initiative #6 and Big 4 Briefing. Continue to support the creation of the Center for Strategic Force Planning (PPSF). Continue to formulate pilot project for the water gap in operations. Apply criteria to the lack of convictions gap and continue concept development. Conduct third working session on NiAF gaps. Support CPCO Commander in developing a concept of operation (CONOPS). Prepare for the Big 4 and Steering Committee presentations. Finalize and present the briefing to the Big 4 Commanders Draft the November 2019 briefing for the Steering Committee (SC). Review progress of Audio, Print, & Social Media Strategic Communications regarding promotion and evaluation policies. Follow up on Presidential approval of the Evaluation Policy, as well as implementation of promotion and assignment policies. Complete the Codage...
